channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Motorists Warned As Parking Lot Cyber Scammers Strike—FBI Says Do 7 Things
item.description: As cyber scammers targeting motorists in parking lots in order to steal payment card details spike, the FBI has the advice to prevent becoming a victim of QR code fraud.

item.title: The paradox of lottery thinking
item.description: Tim Brownson points us to this recent poll of people in Great Britain. About one out of four people surveyed (of all ages) believe that they could qualify for the Olympics if they trained for the next four years. This is absurd. It’s the very absurdity of it that makes it common. “I could do […]

item.title: Your Platform Engineering Team Wants To Build A Custom IDP: Here Are 5 Reasons To Let Them
item.description: Here are some key reasons why I think you're better off investing in a custom IDP.

item.title: Long-term selfish
item.description: Everyone is selfish. We do things that increase our chances of survival, help us achieve our goals and give us a story we can tell ourselves about our role in the community. But short-term selfish is something we try to grow out of. Short-term selfish runs a red light because we’re in a hurry. It […]

item.title: After Surviving Anorexia, This Founder Raised $110 Million To Treat The Deadly Disease Online
item.description: Insurers like UnitedHealthcare, Aetna and Cigna pay for Equip's specialized virtual eating disorder therapy for kids and adults.

item.title: Multiple choice
item.description: “None of the above” is often the best option. We’re regularly confronted with multiple-choice questions. The foundation is already established, the options are already limited, do you want this or that? But the real questions lie in the assumptions that happened before you were even asked. When a developer brings you six website options, they’re […]

item.title: This High-Tech Factory Makes Parts For Rockets And Fighter Jets 10 Times Faster
item.description: Hadrian founder and CEO Chris Power has raised $180 million to manufacture metal parts at warp speeds at his California factory. Now he’s got plans to build a network of them across the country to make more parts better, faster and cheaper.

item.title: Mediocrity and perfectionism
item.description: It’s surprising to realize that they’re the same. They are both places to hide. When we ship average work, it’s not our fault. We’re simply doing what the manual says, and if you don’t like it, blame the culture and the system. And when we hold back on shipping because it isn’t perfect, we’re also […]

item.title: Building Trust In AI: Ethical Practices For Technology Companies
item.description: While we use technology to make a positive impact in the world, we should remember that technology serves people, and we have a responsibility to develop it ethically.

item.title: Fire inspectors
item.description: Running into a burning building is heroic work. Keeping buildings from burning down in the first place is actually just as important. And it scales more reliably.
